***
## Datasets used in research and published as excel files

***
Data are freely available for use. Its reuse in scientific publications, reports, etc. requires citation of its correspondent publication to acknowledge the authors.

<img src="files/Screenshot 59.png" style="width:70%">

***

+ Dataset of occurrences of seagrass species used in the paper: Predicted regime shift in the seagrass ecosystem of the Gulf of Arguin driven by climate change. Published as Supplementary data (Appendix A), check [here](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2351989421004406?via%3Dihub)

+ Raw abundance waterbird data surveyed in saltpans of Ria Formosa during four seasons. Published as Supplementary data (Appendix A) in ["Seasonal variations of waterbird ecological networks under different saltpans management"](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1574954121001552#s0075).

+ Dataset of occurrences compiled for *Cymodocea nodosa*. Published as [Supporting Information - Table S1](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/gcb.14401) of the manuscript entitled "Dramatic loss of seagrass habitat under projected climate change in the Mediterranean Sea".

+ Dataset of occurrences compiled for *Posidonia oceanica*. Published as [Electronic supplementary material - Dataset 1](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-017-03006-2#Sec10) of the manuscript entitled "Palaeoclimatic conditions in the Mediterranean explain genetic diversity of *Posidonia oceanica* seagrass meadows".

+ Dataset of occurrences compiled for *Sargassum muticum*. Published as
[Supporting information - AppendixS1](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/ddi.12910) of the manuscript entitled "Integrating reproductive phenology in ecological niche models changed the predicted future ranges of a marine invader".
